articles.author: Shruti Sonal
articles.title: SE Asia Stocks-Most ring in New Year on a high note; Philippines, Indonesia fall
articles.description:
Most Southeast Asian stock markets ended
the first trading session of 2020 higher on Thursday as they
cheered signs of an impending Phase 1 Sino-U.S. trade deal,
while Philippine and Indonesian shares dragged. 
    U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday …

articles.author: Sudarshan Varadhan
articles.title: India electricity supply down 1.1% in December, declines for fifth straight month
articles.description: India's electricity supply fell for the fifth straight month in December, provisional government data showed, potentially reflecting sluggish industrial activity amid an overall economic slowdown.
articles.content:
NEW DELHI (Reuters) - India’s electricity supply fell for the fifth straight month in December, provisional government data showed, potentially reflecting sluggish industrial activity amid an overall economic slowdown. 
Power supply fell to 101.92 billion un… [+1514 chars]

articles.title: More talks needed on shape of Tunisian government before vote
articles.description: Tunisia's designated prime minister will hold more talks on forming a government, the presidential office said, delaying parliament's vote on the new cabinet that had been expected on Thursday.
articles.content:
TUNIS (Reuters) - Tunisia’s designated prime minister will hold more talks on forming a government, the presidential office said, delaying parliament’s vote on the new cabinet that had been expected on Thursday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UK manufacturing output slides at fastest rate since 2012 - PMI
articles.description: British factory output fell in December at the fastest rate since 2012 as a tepid global economy hurt demand and businesses further reduced stocks of goods they had built up in case of a no-deal Brexit, a survey showed on Thursday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - British factory output fell in December at the fastest rate since 2012 as a tepid global economy hurt demand and businesses further reduced stocks of goods they had built up in case of a no-deal Brexit, a survey showed on Thursday. 
The ou… [+2323 chars]

articles.author: Yereth Rosen
articles.title: Five fishermen believed dead in Alaska shipwreck: Coast Guard
articles.description: Five commercial fishermen were believed to have died after their crabbing vessel sank on New Year's Eve in the Gulf of Alaska, the U.S. Coast Guard said after ending a search and rescue operation amid high winds and heavy seas.
articles.content: ANCHORAGE, Alaska (Reuters) - Five commercial fishermen were believed to have died after their crabbing vessel sank on New Year’s Eve in the Gulf of Alaska, the U.S. Coast Guard said after ending a search and rescue operation amid high winds and heavy seas. … [+1463 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Denmark sets new record sourcing 47% of power from wind in 2019
articles.description: Denmark sourced close to half its electricity consumption from wind power last year, a new record for the Nordic country and an important step in realizing one of the world's most ambitious climate targets.
articles.content:
COPENHAGEN (Reuters) - Denmark sourced close to half its electricity consumption from wind power last year, a new record for the Nordic country and an important step in realizing one of the world’s most ambitious climate targets.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: German employment hits record high in 2019
articles.description: German employment reached a record high in 2019 as higher labour-market participation and increased immigration of foreign workers more than offset demographic change, the statistics office said on Thursday.
articles.content:
BERLIN (Reuters) - German employment reached a record high in 2019 as higher labour-market participation and increased immigration of foreign workers more than offset demographic change, the statistics office said on Thursday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Austrian sensor maker AMS secures 59.9% Osram stake
articles.description: Austrian sensor maker AMS on Thursday said it had secured a 59.9% stake in German lighting group Osram, reaching a 55% minimum threshold but falling short of a 75% hurdle needed to tap Osram's profits.
articles.content:
MUNICH (Reuters) - Austrian sensor maker AMS on Thursday said it had secured a 59.9% stake in German lighting group Osram, reaching a 55% minimum threshold but falling short of a 75% hurdle needed to tap Osram’s profits. 
Hedge funds bought up a substantial … [+1104 chars]

articles.title: VW starts settlement talks with German consumer groups over diesel scandal
articles.description: Volkswagen on Thursday said it was in talks to discuss a settlement with German vehicle owners who are suing the carmaker over excessive pollution caused by VW's diesel cars.
articles.content:
FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Volkswagen on Thursday said it was in talks to discuss a settlement with German vehicle owners who are suing the carmaker over excessive pollution caused by VW’s diesel cars.

articles.title: Erdogan says up to 250,000 people fleeing from Syria's Idlib towards Turkey
articles.description: President Tayyip Erdogan said on Thursday that up to 250,000 migrants were fleeing from the northwestern Syrian region of Idlib towards Turkey, adding that Ankara was trying to prevent them from crossing its border.
articles.content:
ANKARA (Reuters) - President Tayyip Erdogan said on Thursday that up to 250,000 migrants were fleeing from the northwestern Syrian region of Idlib towards Turkey, adding that Ankara was trying to prevent them from crossing its border.
